        The logic holds.
        Premise 1: Kernel is immutable.
        Premise 2: Worlds are mutable.
        Mechanism: Worlds shadow Kernel.
        Exception: Locked List blocks Shadowing.
        Conclusion: System remains safe while allowing extension.
        No internal contradictions found. The "Exception" mechanism resolves the conflict.

        The destination is good, but the journey involves "Rename/Migrate core assets". 
        This means every existing path in the repo breaks. 
        The "Implementation Plan" touches lightly on this ("Update Loader Logic"), 
        but underestimates the pain of breaking every existing import. 
        Where is the backward compatibility layer?
